content.raw:
I created most of the drone.io jobs, mainly as an experiment. I'll add some documentation to the internal wiki.

It works quite well for [ign-math](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-math) and [sdformat](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat), compiling, checking for compiler errors, running `make test`, `sudo make install`, and then code check.

There is a time limit on the free version of drone.io, which is not enough time to compile gazebo, so I set it to run `tools/bitbucket_pullrequests -c 0` to run the code checker on the files changed by the most recent commit. Also, drone.io is using precise, which has an old version of cppcheck that gave some weird errors, so I asked Jose to make a PPA with a more recent cppcheck for precise. At the time, cppcheck 1.67 was the most recent, so he built that.
